# 
We now describe when the“double integral”can be obtained as an "iterated"integral(Fubini!) 
Proposition.Let  $S:P^{\mathrm{op}}\times P\times C^{\mathrm{op}}\times C{\rightarrow}X$  be a fun ctor such that theend  $\int_{c}S(p,q,c,c)$  existsforallpairs  $\langle p,q\rangle$  ofobjectsof  $P$  ;bythe parameter theorems,regard these ends as abi fun ctor  $P^{\mathrm{op}}\times P{\rightarrow}X$  ,and regard  $s$  asabifunctor  $(P\times C)^{\mathrm{op}}\times(P\times C){\to}X$  Thenthereisaniso- morphism 

$$
\theta:\int\displaylimits_{\langle p,c\rangle}S(p,c,p,c)\cong\int\displaylimits_{p}\left[\int\displaylimits_{c}S(p,p,c,c)\right].
$$
 
Indeed,the“doubleend”on theleftexistsif andonlyiftheend  $\int_{p}$  onthe rightexists,andthenthereisauniquearrow  $\theta$  in  $X$  such that the diagram 

$$
\begin{array}{l}{{\displaystyle\int_{\langle p,c\rangle}S(p,p,c,c)\,\xrightarrow[\theta]{\xi\langle p,c\rangle}S(p,p,c,c)}}\\ {{\displaystyle\int_{\langle p,c\rangle}S(p,p,c,c)\bigg|\,\xrightarrow[\phi]{\theta}\,\int S(p,p,c,c)\,\xrightarrow[\phi]{\omega_{p,p,c}}S(p,p,c,c)}}\end{array}
$$
 
commutes,where the horizontal arrows  $\xi,\varrho$  and  $\omega$  aretheuniversalwedges belonging to the corresponding ends;moreover,the arrow  $\theta$  isaniso- morphism. 
Proof.Foreach  $\langle p,q\rangle\in P\times P$  we aregiven the end 

$$
\omega_{p,\,q}:\int_{c}S(p,q,c,c){\leftrightarrows}S(p,q,\mathrm{\tiny~-~},\mathrm{\tiny~-~})\,.
$$
 
For any  $x\in X$  each  $P$  -indexed family  $\rho_{p}:x\rightarrow\int_{c}S(p,p,c,c)$  ofarrows of  $X$  determines a  $(P\times C)$  -indexed family  $\xi_{p,c}$  as the composites 

$$
\xi_{p,c}:x\xrightarrow{\varrho_{p}}\int S(p,p,c,c)\,\xrightarrow{\omega_{p,p,c}}S(p,p,c,c)\,;
$$
 
 $p$   $\xi_{\langle p,\mathrm{~-~}\rangle}$   $\omega_{p,p}$  universal,every  $(P\times C)$  -indexed family which is natural in  $c$  for each  $p$  is such a composite,for a unique family  $\varrho$  Now  $\varrho$  or  $\xi$  is extranatural in  $p$  (the latter for some  $c$  )ifandonlyif the corresponding square below 

$$
\begin{array}{r l r}{\underset{\underset{\varepsilon}{\varepsilon}}{x\longrightarrow}\underset{\underset{\varepsilon}{\varepsilon}}{\longrightarrow}\int\underset{\underset{\varepsilon}{c}}{S(p,p,c,c)}}&{\ \ }&{\ \underset{\varepsilon}{x\longrightarrow}\underset{\underset{\varepsilon}{\varepsilon}}{\longrightarrow}S(p,p,c,c)}\\ {\int\underset{\underset{\varepsilon}{c}}{S(q,q,c,c)}\underset{\underset{\varepsilon}{\longrightarrow}\int}\int\underset{\underset{\varepsilon}{c}}{S(p,q,c,c)}\,,}&{\ \ }&{\ \underset{\varepsilon}{S(q,q,c,c)}\,\underset{\longrightarrow}{\longrightarrow}S(p,q,c,c)}\end{array}
$$
